smell_analysis.justification: All pages in the PDF contain visible diagrams and elements; no empty diagrams were found.
In the Use Case diagram (Page 2), all use cases are associated with actors, either directly or via '<<include>>' relationships (e.g., 'Tuvasta kasutaja' is included by use cases triggered by actors).
No use cases with synonymous names for the same actor were found. The use cases describe distinct functionalities (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Registreeri', 'Muuda').
The package diagram (Page 1) does not contain multiple elements with the same name within the same package.
No redundant data copies were found in unconnected tables. Common column names like 'reg_aeg' (Page 13, 18) refer to entity-specific timestamps, not denormalized data.
All use cases in the diagram (Page 2) consistently start with a verb in the imperative form (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Registreeri', 'Lõpeta').
In the State Diagram (Page 11), all states ('Ootel', 'Aktiivne', etc.) are reachable from the start node via defined transitions.
In the Activity Diagrams (Pages 3 and 4), all actions are reachable through the defined decision paths.

All relationships in the class and database diagrams appear to have multiplicity indicators at one or both ends (e.g., '0..*' and '1'). No relationships were found completely lacking indicators at both ends.
The Use Case diagram 'Väljakute funktsionaalne allsüsteem' (Page 2) contains 11 central use case elements (ovals), which exceeds the limit of fewer than 10.
No single element has 6 or more visual connections on a single diagram. The maximum observed was 5 (e.g., 'Isik' on Pages 6/13 and 'Väljak' on Page 10).
The layout of the diagrams is balanced, and no related elements are placed excessively far apart compared to the average distance.
All use cases and activity actions start with active verbs (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Otsi', 'Vali').
All class, table, attribute, and use case names differ by more than 3 characters (shortest found were 'Riik' and 'Isik', both 4 characters).
All class names start with an uppercase letter and are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Väljak', 'Klient').
All attributes and columns start with a lowercase letter (e.g., 'nimetus', 'isikukood').
All database table names are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Riik', 'Väljak').
No Hungarian notation prefixes (like 'tbl_', 'str') were found on class, table, or attribute names.
